<|endoftext|>/*
Check if in given vector of numbers, are any two numbers closer to each other than
given threshold.
>>> has_close_elements({1.0, 2.0, 3.0}, 0.5)
false
>>> has_close_elements({1.0, 2.8, 3.0, 4.0, 5.0, 2.0}, 0.3)
true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <math.h>
using std;
bool has_close_elements(vector < float > numbers, float threshold) {
    int i, j;
   
    for (i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {
        for (j = i + 1; j < numbers.size(); j++) {
            if (fabs(numbers[i] - numbers[j]) < threshold) {
                return true;
            }
        }
    }
    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a positive integer n, you have to make a pile of n levels of stones.
The first level has n stones.
The number of stones in the next level is:
    - the next odd number if n is odd.
    - the next even number if n is even.
Return the number of stones in each level in a vector, where element at index
i represents the number of stones in the level (i+1).

Examples:
>>> make_a_pile(3)
{3, 5, 7}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < int > make_a_pile(int n) {
   
   vector < int > pile;
   pile.reserve(n);
   
   for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
      pile.push_back(i);
   }
   
   for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
      if (n % 2 == 0) {
         pile[i] = pile[i - 1] + 2;
      } else {
         pile[i] = pile[i - 1] + 1;
      }
   }
   
   return pile;
}

vector < int > unique_digits(vector < int > x) {

        }

            }

    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Out of vector of strings, return the longest one. Return the first one in case of multiple
strings of the same length. Return None in case the input vector is empty.
>>> longest({})

>>> longest({"a", "b", "c"})
"a"
>>> longest({"a", "bb", "ccc"})
"ccc"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
string longest(vector < string > strings) {
    string out;
   
    if (strings.size() == 0) {
        return out;
    }
    
    string longest = strings[0];
    
    for (size_t i = 1; i < strings.size(); i++) {
        if (strings[i].size() > longest.size()) {
            longest = strings[i];
        }
    }
    
    out = longest;
    
    return out;
}

strings of the same length. Return None in case the input vector is empty.

"c"
>>> longest({"a", "bb", "ccc"})
"ccc"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>

string longestReverse(vector < string > strings) {
    string out;
   
    if (strings.size() == 0) {
        return out;
    }
    
    string longest = strings[0];
    
    for (size_t i = 1; i < strings.size(); i++) {
        if (strings[i].size() > longest.size()) {
            longest = strings[i];
        }
    }
    
    out = strings[strings.size() - 1 - strings.size() % strings.size()];
    
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
Example
is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == false
is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == false
is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_equal_to_sum_even(int n) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
      if (n % 2 == 0 && i!= 0 && i % 2!= 0) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   return true;
}

*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_equal_to_sum_odd(int n) {
   
   for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
      if (n % 2!= 0 && i!= 0 && i % 2!= 0) {
         return false;
      }
   }
   return true;
}

288

factorial of this integer.

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function which takes a string representing a file's name, and returns
"Yes" if the the file's name is valid, and returns "No" otherwise.
A file's name is considered to be valid if and only if all the following conditions 
are met:
- There should not be more than three digits ('0'-'9') in the file's name.
- The file's name contains exactly one dot "."
- The substring before the dot should not be empty, and it starts with a letter from 
the latin alphapet ('a'-'z' and 'A'-'Z').
- The substring after the dot should be one of these: {'txt", "exe", "dll"}
Examples:
file_name_check("example.txt") => "Yes"
file_name_check("1example.dll")  => "No" // (the name should start with a latin alphapet letter)
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
string file_name_check(string file_name) {
    int numdigit = 0, numdot = 0;
    if (file_name.length() < 5) return "No";
    char w = file_name [ 0 ];
    if (w < 65 or(w > 90 and w < 97) or w > 122) return "No";
    string last = file_name.substr(file_name.length() - 4, 4);
   
    for(int i = 0; i < last.length(); i++) {
        char c = last[i];
        if (c == '.') numdot++;
        if (c == '0' or c == '9') numdigit++;
    }
    if (numdigit > 3 or numdot > 1 or numdot < 2) return "No";
    if (file_name.substr(0, 1) == "-" or file_name.substr(0, 1) == ".") return "No";
    
    string first = file_name.substr(0, 1);
    if (first.length() > 1 and first[0] < 'a' or first[0] > 'z') return "No";
    
    string ext = file_name.substr(file_name.length() - 4, 4);
    if (ext!= "txt" and ext!= "exe" and ext!= "dll") return "No";
    return "Yes";
}

#include <string>
using std;
string file_name_check(string file_name) {
    int numdigit = 0, numdot = 0;
    if (file_name.length() < 5) return "No";
    char w = file_name [ 0 ];
    if (w < 65 or(w > 90 and w < 97) or w > 122) return "No";
    string last = file_name.substr(file_name.length() - 4, 4);
   
    for(int i = 0; i < last.length(); i++) {
        char c = last[i];
        if (c == '.') numdot++;
        if (c == '0' or c == '9') numdigit++;
    }
    if (numdigit > 3 or numdot > 1 or numdot < 2) return "No";
    if (file_name.substr(0, 1) == "-" or file_name.substr(0, 1) == ".") return "No";
    
    string first = file_name.substr(0, 1);
    if (first.length() > 1 and first[0] < 'a' or first[0] > 'z') return "No";
    
    string ext = file_name.substr(file_name.length() - 4, 4);
    if (ext!= "txt" and ext!= "exe" and ext!= "dll") return "No";
    return "Yes";
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given an integer. return a vector that has the number of even and odd digits respectively.

 Example:
    even_odd_count(-12) ==> {1, 1}
    even_odd_count(123) ==> {1, 2}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <string>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < int > even_odd_count(int num) {
   
   vector < int > even;
   vector < int > odd;
   
   while (num > 0) {
      int digit = num % 10;
      if (digit % 2 == 0) {
         even.push_back(digit);
      } else {
         odd.push_back(digit);
      }
      num /= 10;
   }
   return even;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Find how many times a given substring can be found in the original string. Count overlaping cases.
>>> how_many_times("", "a")
0
>>> how_many_times("aaa", "a")
3
>>> how_many_times("aaaa", "aa")
3
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
int how_many_times(string str, string substring) {
    int out = 0;
   
    for (int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++) {
        if (str[i] == substring[0]) {
            for (int j = 1; j < substring.size(); j++) {
                if (str[i + j]!= substring[j]) {
                    break;
                }
                else {
                    out++;
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return out;
}

Find how many times a given substring can be found in the original string. Count overlaping cases.
>>> how_many_times("", "a")
0
>>> how_many_times("aaa", "a")
3
>>> how_many_times("aaaa", "aa")
3
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
int how_many_times(string str, string substring) {
    int out = 0;
   
    for (int i = 0; i < str.size(); i++) {
        if (str[i] == substring[0]) {
            for (int j = 1; j < substring.size(); j++) {
                if (str[i + j]!= substring[j]) {
                    break;
                }
                else {
                    out++;
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter given vector of any python values only for integers
>>> filter_integers({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filter_integers({1, 2, 3, "abc", {}, {}})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
#include <boost/any.hpp>
#include <list>
typedef std :: list < boost :: any > list_any;
using std;
vector < int > filter_integers(list_any values) {
    list_any :: iterator it;
   
    vector < int > result;
    for (it = values.begin(); it!= values.end(); ++it) {
        int value = boost::any_cast<int>(*it);
        if (value == 0) {
            continue;
        }
        result.push_back(value);
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Concatenate vector of strings into a single string
>>> concatenate({})
""
>>> concatenate({"a", "b", "c"})
"abc"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
string concatenate(vector < string > strings) {
   
   string result;
   
   for (auto it = strings.begin(); it!= strings.end(); ++it) {
      result += *it;
   }
   
   return result;
}

/*
Count the number of times a character appears in a string
>>> count("abcabc", "b")
2
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
int count(string s, char c) {
   int count = 0;
   
   for (auto it = s.begin(); it!= s.end(); ++it) {
      if (*it == c) {
         ++count;
      }
   }
   
   return count;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that start with a given prefix.
>>> filter_by_prefix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_prefix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > filter_by_prefix(vector < string > strings, string prefix) {
   
   vector < string > result;
   
   for (auto & s : strings) {
      if (s.substr(0, prefix.size()) == prefix) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that end with a given suffix.
>>> filter_by_suffix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_suffix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > filter_by_suffix(vector < string > strings, string suffix) {
   
   vector < string > result;
   
   for (auto & s : strings) {
      if (s.substr(s.size() - suffix.size(), suffix.size()) == suffix) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that contain a given substring.
>>> filter_by_substring({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_substring({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using std;
vector < string > filter_by_substring(vector < string > strings, string substring) {
   
   vector < string > result;
   
   for (auto & s : strings) {
      if (s.find(substring)!= string::npos) {
         result.push_back(s);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

{5, 3, 2, 3, 9, 123, 1}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < float > get_positive(vector < float > l) {
   
   vector < float > result;
   
   for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      if (l[i] > 0) {
         result.push_back(l[i]);
      }
   }
   
   return result;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.

    */

    for (size_t i = 1; i < xs.size(); i++) {
        dxs.push_back(xs[i] * i);

        double result = 0.0;

    double x3 = xs[2];
    double x4 = xs[3];

}

<|endoftext|>/*
brackets is a string of '<' and '>'.
return true if every opening bracket has a corresponding closing bracket.

>>> correct_bracketing("<")
false
>>> correct_bracketing("<>")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("<<><>>")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("><<>")
false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
bool correct_bracketing(string brackets) {
    int level = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < brackets.length(); i++)
     {
       
       if (brackets[i] == '<')
         {
           if (level == 0)
             return false;
           level--;
         }
       else if (brackets[i] == '>')
         {
           if (level == 0)
             return false;
           level++;
         }
       else
         {
           if (level == 0)
             return false;
         }
     }
     return level == 0;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a non-empty vector of integers lst. add the even elements that are at odd indices..


Examples:
    add({4, 2, 6, 7}) ==> 2 
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
int add(vector < int > lst) {
   
    int sum = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++) {
        if (i % 2 == 0) {
            sum += lst[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function encrypt that takes a string as an argument and
returns a string encrypted with the alphabet being rotated. 
The alphabet should be rotated in a manner such that the letters 
shift down by two multiplied to two places.
For example:
encrypt("hi") returns "lm"
encrypt("asdfghjkl") returns "ewhjklnop"
encrypt("gf") returns "kj"
encrypt("et") returns "ix"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
string encrypt(string s) {
    string out;
    int i;
   
    for(i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
        out[i] = s[s.length() - 1 - i];
    }
    return out;
}

Create a function that takes 3 numbers.

Returns false in any other cases.

Examples
any_int(5, 2, 7) ➞ true

any_int(3.6, -2.2, 2) ➞ false



*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
using std;
bool any_int(float a, float b, float c) {
    if (round(a)!= a) return false;
   
    if (round(b)!= b) return false;
   
    if (round(c)!= c) return false;
   
    return true;
}
